resources.string: This is not a functional SMS app.
The base functionality requires just the READ_SMS permission, but only inbox and sent messages can be seen by non-default apps on Marshmallow and above (API levels 23+).
Turning this off has to be handled manually in Settings, since an app can\'t revoke a permission for itself.
Temporarily setting adbsms as the default SMS app will enable full read and write access, but you will lose all messaging functionality for the duration.
There\'s no way to programmatically select a separate app as the default on API levels 29+, so you\'ll have to revert to the original manually.
